alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:06AM EDT until April 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. .Unseasonably warm temperatures are melting snowpack and increasing river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters cover significant portions of County Road LG between M-95 and Michigamme Dam. Houses near Bengtson Bridge in South Republic are further impacted by flood waters * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:10 AM CDT Saturday /8:10 AM EDT Saturday/ the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 10.3 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 830 PM CDT /930 PM EDT/.
